sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SUBMULTIPLE, in geometry, &,c. A ſubmultiple number, or quantity, is that which is contained a certain number of times in another, and which, therefore, repeated a certain number of times, becomes exactly equal thereto. Thus 3 is a ſubmultiple of 21. In which ſenſe a ſubmultiple coincides with an aliquot part.

SUBMULTIPLE Ratio, is that between the quantity contained and the quantity containing. Thus the ratio of 3 to 21 is ſubmultiple. In both caſes ſubmultiple is the reverſe of multiple : 21, e. gr. being a multiple of 3, and the ratio of 21 to 3 a multiple ratio.
